flawed_nl_solution:
The discount for an iPhone 12 is $800 x 15/100 = $<<800*15/100=120>>120.
So, the iPhone will now cost $800 - $120 = $<<800-120=680>>680.
The discount for an iWatch is $300 x 10/100 = $<<300*10/100=30>>30.
So, the iWatch will now cost $300 - $30 = $<<300-30=720>>720.
The total cost of the iPhone and iWatch is $680 + $720 = $<<680+720=1400>>1400.
The cashback will be $1400 x 2/100 = $<<1400*2/100=28>>28.
Thus, Dexter will only pay $1400 - $28 = $<<1400-28=1372>>1372.
#### 1372

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 270, not 720. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
